byline.original: By MICHAEL WINERIP and MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ

abstract: New York State inspector general's office issues report singling out 20 uniformed and civilian workers at Clinton Correctional Facility for dereliction of duty that enabled two prisoners to escape; examination of payroll records by New York Times reveals further that identified workers faced few penalties, and only two, Gene Palmer and Joyce E Mitchell, are facing criminal charges.
lead_paragraph: There have been few serious consequences for most of the employees who enabled two killers to escape from the prison in Dannemora, N.Y., according to an examination of payroll records.

headline.main: 18 Newly Implicated in Killers’ Escape. Zero Fired; Zero Prosecuted.
headline.print_headline: Few Penalties for Workers in Escape of 2 From Prison

snippet: There have been few serious consequences for most of the employees who enabled two killers to escape from the prison in Dannemora, N.Y., according to an examination of payroll records.
